HTML 5 TAGS \t\t HTML TAG: ... \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Specifies an html document. The HTML element (or HTML root element) represents the root of an HTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element. Since the element is the first in a document other than comments, it is called the root element. Although this tag can be implied, or not required, with HTML, it is required to be opened and closed in XHTML. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nxmlns + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n basic tag.. \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ...\n ...\n \t\t BASE TAG: ... \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Specifies URL which non-absolute URLs are relative to. The HTML element specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs contained within a document. There can be only one element in a document. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nhref | target (_self | _blank | _parent | _top) + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n title \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n smartglossa\n \n \t\t HEAD TAG: ... \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t First element of the HTML document. Collection of metadata for the Document. The HTML element provides general information (metadata) about the document, including its title and links to its scripts and style sheets. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\n global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n ... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ... \n \n \n \n \t\t LINK TAG: ... \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Other resources related to the document. The HTML element specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource. Possible uses for this element include defining a relational framework for navigation. This Element is most used to link to style sheets. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nhref | rel | media | hre†ang | type | sizes | crossorigin | integrity + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n \n\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ...\n \n \n \n \n \t\t META TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n The tag provides structured metadata about the document. The element may only appear in the head section of a document, although it may appear any number of times. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\ncharset | content | http-equiv | name + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \t\t STYLE TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Embed style information in the documents. The HTML \n \n Example:\n\n \t\t TITLE TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tHTML tag define a document title that display on browser header. <title> tag define on head section in document. <title> does not support Dynamic attributes or Event attributes.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n <title> This is the page title \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \t\t ADDRESS TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tThe HTML
element supplies contact information for its nearest
or ancestor; in the latter case, it applies to the whole document.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Area Of Address..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
989,smartglossa
\n \n \t\t ARTICLE TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tSection of the page content, such as a blog or forum post. The HTML
element represents a self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable (e.g., in syndication). This could be a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, a blog entry, an object, or any other independent item of content. Each
should be identiတed, typically by including a heading (

-

element) as a child of the
element.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Area Of Address..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

hai smartglossa.

Posted on May 17 by smartglossa.

\n \n \t\t BODY TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tMain content of the document. The HTML Element represents the content of an HTML document. There can be only one element in a document.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nonafterprint | onbeforeprint | onbeforeunload | onblur | onerror | onfocus | onhashchange | onlanguagechange | onload | onmessage | ono†ine | ononline | onpopstate | onredo | onresize | onstorage | onundo | onunload + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n use tags ../body>\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n ... \n \t\t ASIDE TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t such as a advertising or quotes.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
...
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
hai smartglossa
\n \n \t\t FOOTER TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tFooter of the current section. The HTML
element represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element. A footer typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Some copyright documents here
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
Some copyright documents here
\n H1 TO H6 tag:

...
\t\t H1 TO H6 TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Heading for the current section. Heading elements implement six levels of document headings,

is the most important and

is the least.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

..

....
..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

Heading level 1

\n

Heading level 2

\n

Heading level 3

\n

Heading level 4

\n
Heading level 5
\n
Heading level 6
\n \n \t\t HEADER TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Search form
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
Search form
\n \t\t HGROUP TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t The HTML
Element (HTML Headings Group Element) represents the heading of a section. It defines a single title that participates in the outline of the document as the heading of the implicit or explicit section that it belongs to. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

Main title

Secondary title

\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

Main title

Secondary title

\n \t\t NAV TAG:
...
\n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t A section of a page that links to other pages. The HTML
element (HTML Navigation Element) represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
  • ...
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
      \n
    • Home
      • \n
    • About us
      • \n
    • Contact us
      • \n
    \n
    \n \n \t\t SECTION TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tContains of elements grouped by theme, for example a chapter or tab box. The HTML
    element represents a generic section of a document, i.e., a thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading. Each
    should be identified, typically by including a heading (

    -

    element) as a child of the
    element. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

    Heading

    smartglossa page content

    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

    Heading

    Bunch of awesome content

    \n \t\t BLOCKQUOTE TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tQuote from another source. The HTML
    Element (or HTML Block Quotation Element) indicates that the enclosed text is an extended quotation .\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\ncite + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

    smartglossa website

    <\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

    smartglossa website

    \n \t\t BR TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tLine break. The HTML element line break
    produces a line break in text (carriage-return). \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

    Review
    87,North Street
    tamilnadu

    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

    Review
    87,North Street
    tamilnadu

    \n \t\t DD TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tDescription, definition, or value, part of a term- description group in a description list. The HTML
    element (HTML Description Element) indicates the description of a term in a description list (
    ) element. This element can occur only as a child element of a description list and it must follow a
    element. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
    ..
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
    Review Squirrel
    Helps you find the best tools for running a small business website
    \n \t\t DIV TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tContainer or section with no semantic meaning. The HTML
    element (or HTML Document Division Element) is the generic container for †ow content, which does not inherently represent anything. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
    ...
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

    Any kind of content here. Such as

    , . You name it!

    \n \t\t DL TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tAn association list consisting of zero or more name-value groups (a description list). The HTML
    element (or HTML Description List Element) encloses a list of pairs of terms and descriptions. Common uses for this element are to implement a glossary or to display metadata (a list of key-value pairs). Prior to HTML5,
    was known as a Deတnition List. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
    ..
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
    Review Squirrel
    \n
    Helps you find the best tools for running a small business website
    \n
    \n \t\t DT TAG:
    ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tTerm, or name, part of a term-description group in a description list. The HTML
    element (or HTML Deတnition Term Element) identiတes a term in a definition list. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
    ..
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
    Review Squirrel
    \n
    Helps you find the best tools for running a small business website
    \n
    \n \t\t FIGCAPTION TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Caption or legend for the တgure element. The HTML <တgcaption> element represents a caption or a legend associated with a figure or an illustration described by the rest of the data of the

    ... Element (or HTML Table Caption Element) represents the title of a table. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n ....
    \n \n \n \n \n

    MonthSavings
    \n \n \t\t COL TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Columns in a table. The HTML Table Column Element () deတnes a column within a table and is used for defining common semantics on all common cells. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nspan + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n using table format\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    Monthly savings
    MonthSavings
    \n \n \t\t COLGROUP TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tDefines a group of columns in a table. The HTML Table Column Group Element () deတnes a group of columns within a table. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nspan + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    Monthly savings
    MonthSavings
    January$100
    February$50
    \n \t\t TABLE TAG: ...
    \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tTable of multi-dimensional data. The HTML Table Element () represents tabular data: information expressed via two dimensions or more. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nsummary + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
    ....
    \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    MonthSavings
    \n \n \t\t TBODY TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n ..header information... \n \n \n ..footer information... \n \n \n ..first row of block one data...\n \n ..second row of block one data...\n \n
    \n \n \t\t TD TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Table cell. The Table cell HTML element () deတnes a cell of a table that contains data. It participates in the table model. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\ncolspan | rowspan | headers + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    MonthSavings
    \n \n \t\t TFOOT TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tContains rows with summary of data. The HTML Table Foot Element () deတnes a set of rows summarizing the columns of the table. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n ...header information... \n \n \n ...footer information... \n \n \n
    \n \n \t\t TH TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tTable heading. The HTML element table header cell deတnes a cell as a header for a group of cells of a table. The group of cells that the header refers to is deတned by the scope and headers attribute.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\ncolspan | rowspan | scope | headers + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    MonthSavings
    January$100
    \n \n \t\t THEAD TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tContains rows with table headings. The HTML Table Head Element () defines a set of rows deတning the head of the columns of the table. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n ...header information... \n \n \n ...footer information... \n \n \n ...first row of block one data...\n \n ...second row of block one data...\n \n
    \n \t\t TR TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tA row of cells in a table. The HTML element table row deတnes a row of cells in a table. Those can be a mix of and elements. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
    MonthSavings
    \n \n \t\t BUTTON TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t A button. The HTML \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \t\t DATA TAG: ... \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tAllows for machine-readable data to be provided. The HTML Element links a given content with a machine-readable translation. If the content is time- or date-related, the must be used.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nvalue + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n .... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
